io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.factory

Interface ISyncTargetFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SyncTargetFactoryFromDI

    public interface ISyncTargetFactory
    A factory to create all synchronization target specific implementation classes.

    In order to avoid depending on specific implementations of any dependency frameworks, implementing classes provide factory functions to create all necessary instances.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ISyncTarget createSyncTarget()
      creates an instance of the synchronization target instance.
      IAuthTokenStorage getAuthTokenStorage()
      creates a token storage to deliver the settings for authentication to the Smint.IO RESTful API.
      ISyncJobDataStorage getJobDataStorage()
      creates a job data storage to make job data available for next run.
      ISettingsModel getSettings()
      return the current settings for the synchronization process, which may have changed in the meantime.

    • Method Detail

      • createSyncTarget

        ISyncTarget createSyncTarget()
        creates an instance of the synchronization target instance.

        Since the synchronization target is a heavy class with a lot of cache data, it seems better to create a new instance on each call. However, the implementor of the sync target need to decide whether it is necessary to create a new instance on each call or not. At the moment the default implementation of ISyncJob, which is DefaultSyncJob, reuses the target for all synchronization processes as long as the job is being scheduled. As soon as the job is being rescheduled, a new synchronization target will be created.

        Returns:
        returns a new sync target on each call.

      • getSettings

        ISettingsModel getSettings()
        return the current settings for the synchronization process, which may have changed in the meantime.

        This function is called very, very often. So please use some form of caching to check, whether the data really have changed from one call to another. Although the settings hardly change, they might do.

        Returns:
        returns the currently valid settings on each request.

      • getAuthTokenStorage

        IAuthTokenStorage getAuthTokenStorage()
        creates a token storage to deliver the settings for authentication to the Smint.IO RESTful API.
        Returns:
        the same authentication token storage on each request but must not return null.

      • getJobDataStorage

        ISyncJobDataStorage getJobDataStorage()
        creates a job data storage to make job data available for next run.

        If this function returns null, then an in-memory storage is used as default. The job data will be available for different runs but will automatically removed from memory, once the sync jobs are stopped and terminated. Nevertheless, it should be sufficient for most cases.

        Returns:
        the same storage on each request or null.
